item.title: 乐观的采购经理人指数数据增强复苏希望，中国股市上涨
item.description: 制造业活动的反弹增强了人们对中国经济复苏可能开始获得牵引力的希望，中国股市因此上扬。【原文：Chinese stocks advanced as a rebound in manufacturing activity reinforced hopes that the nation’s economic recovery may be starting to gain traction.】

item.title: 前官员称日本央行下次加息最早可能在 10 月
item.description: 日本央行的一位前官员是该国著名的通胀专家之一，他表示，日本央行可能会慢慢等待再次加息，最早可能在 10 月份加息。【原文：The Bank of Japan will probably take its time before raising interest rates again, with October likely being the earliest it might move next, according to a former BOJ official renowned as one of the nation’s leading inflation experts.】

item.title: 外资涌入印度债券市场引发市场轰动
item.description: 印度被纳入全球主要债券指数的分水岭使大量现金涌入印度，这已经在重塑这个长期以来热衷于避免热钱流入的国家的市场。【原文：Cash pouring into India from its watershed inclusion into key global bond indexes is already reshaping markets in a country long keen to insulate itself from hot money flows.】

item.title: 中国建筑业前景黯淡，铁矿石跌至 10 个月低点
item.description: 铁矿石跌至 10 个月来的最低水平，原因是中国长达数年的房地产危机使价格持续承压，即使有更广泛的增长回升迹象。【原文：Iron ore dropped to the lowest level in 10 months as China’s years-long property crisis keeps pressure on prices even amid wider signs of a pick-up in growth.】

item.title: 瑞穗将扩大对日本小型企业并购业务的关注
item.description: 瑞穗金融集团公司（Mizuho Financial Group Inc.【原文：Mizuho Financial Group Inc. will expand its mergers and acquisitions business for small and medium-sized Japanese companies that have traditionally been under served.】

item.title: 新加坡房价第三季度逆势上涨
item.description: 新加坡房价连续第三个季度上涨，尽管几个月来销售不温不火，但市场仍避免了下跌。【原文：Singapore home prices rose for a third consecutive quarter, as the market dodged a decline despite months of tepid sales.】

item.title: 印度、韩国和日本将继续忙于 IPO，而中国则停滞不前
item.description: 亚太地区的首次公开募股经历了五年来最糟糕的一个季度后，预计韩国、印度和日本的活动将有所回升，而中国的交易可能依然稀少。【原文：After the worst quarter in five years for Asia Pacific initial public offerings, a pick up activity is expected from South Korea, India and Japan while Chinese deals are likely to remain sparse.】

item.title: 美国通胀降温助推降息押注，黄金升至创纪录水平
item.description: 随着第二季度拉开帷幕，黄金涨至创纪录水平，延续了美联储接近降息和地缘政治紧张局势深化所推动的涨势。【原文：Gold rose to a record as the second quarter kicked off, extending a rally that’s been driven by the Federal Reserve moving closer to rate cuts and deepening geopolitical tensions.】

item.title: 日本央行的债券储量将自 2008 年以来首次缩水
item.description: 日本政府债券的投资者可能不仅要面对潜在的加息这一利空因素，还要面对央行最快在下个季度减持大量债券的情况。【原文：Investors in Japan’s government bonds are likely to confront not only potential interest-rate hikes as a bearish factor but also a reduction in the central bank’s vast bond holdings as soon as next quarter.】

item.title: 石油价格在季度大涨后趋于平稳，中国需求成为关注焦点
item.description: 由于中国的数据增加了经济复苏的迹象，支撑了需求前景，石油在结束了第一季度的强劲涨势后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after capping a solid first-quarter gain as data from China added to signs of a recovery, bolstering the demand outlook.】

item.title: 日本交易所大涨得益于首席执行官山路推动改革
item.description: 自山路博美（Hiromi Yamaji）一年前就任东京证券交易所运营商首席执行官以来，日本交易所集团公司（Japan Exchange Group Inc.【原文：Shares of Japan Exchange Group Inc. have doubled in value since Hiromi Yamaji became the chief executive officer of the Tokyo Stock Exchange’s operator a year ago.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将因美联储等待更多数据而上涨：市场综述
item.description: 由于美联储重申不急于降息，并将等待通胀得到控制的更多证据，亚洲股市似乎将高开。【原文：Equity markets in Asia look set to open higher as the Federal Reserve reiterated it’s in no rush to cut interest rates and will await more evidence that inflation is under control.】

item.title: Gildan 前首席执行官抨击可能的出售，公布回归战略
item.description: Gildan Activewear Inc. 的前首席执行官表示，如果他重返岗位，他有一个到 2028 年让这家服装制造商的利润几乎翻一番的战略—；他还表示，与把公司卖给出价最高的竞标者相比，他的计划对投资者更有利。【原文：Gildan Activewear Inc.’s former chief executive officer said he has a strategy to nearly double the clothing maker’s profits by 2028 if he returns to the job — and that investors will be better off with his plan than selling the company to the highest bidder.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 巴尔的摩一座桥梁的坍塌有可能中断东海岸一个重要港口的商品出口，其中包括一大部分美国煤炭运输。由于中国需求疲软，铁矿石价格将跌至5月以来的最低点。石油和天然气行业疯狂的交易仍在继续，今年开局表现强劲。【原文：The collapse of a Baltimore bridge has threatened to disrupt commodity exports — including a significant chunk of US coal shipments — from an important East Coast port. item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：泰晤士水务业主将启动重组谈判
item.description: 英国《金融时报》援引不愿透露姓名的知情人士的话报道，由于母公司肯布尔水务控股有限公司（Kemble Water Holdings Ltd. ）可能面临破产，泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water Utilities Ltd. ）的所有者将在未来几天内开始重组谈判。【原文：The owners of Thames Water Utilities Ltd. will start restructuring talks in the coming days as parent company Kemble Water Holdings Ltd. faces potential insolvency, the Financial Times reported, citing unidentified people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 新日铁新总裁称协议只会加强美国钢铁业
item.description: 新日本钢铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp.）新任总裁承诺将继续推进以 141 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司（United States Steel Corp.【原文：Nippon Steel Corp.’s new chief has pledged to press on with the $14.1 billion acquisition of United States Steel Corp., a deal that he says is vital to making the American company more competitive.】

item.title: 巴尔的摩船舶事故导致东海岸港口争相吞吐货物
item.description: 美国东海岸的港口正在调整作业，以吸收从巴尔的摩港分流出来的货物。在巴尔的摩港，打捞专家正在开始清理被摧毁的弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥上的残骸这一艰巨任务。【原文：Ports along the US East Coast are modifying their operations to absorb cargo diverted from Baltimore harbor, where salvage specialists are starting the daunting task of clearing debris from the destroyed Francis Scott Key Bridge.】

item.title: 银行业主管称日本面临来自美国和中国经济的风险
item.description: 日本银行业协会负责人表示，日本经济正面临着来自两个最大贸易伙伴的价格压力的风险。【原文：Japan’s economy is at risk from price pressures from its two largest trading partners, according to the chief of the country’s banking association.】

item.title: 美国石油供应商强势进入全球欧佩克+市场
item.description: 制裁俄罗斯和委内瑞拉石油的一个主要受益者是什么？美国的石油供应商，他们凭借自己的力量打入了曾经由欧佩克及其盟友主导的市场。【原文：One major beneficiary of sanctions on Russian and Venezuelan oil? US suppliers who’ve muscled their way into markets once dominated by OPEC and its allies.】

item.title: 中国售房荒持续，转机渺茫
item.description: 3 月份，中国房屋销售持续低迷，这表明人们寄予厚望的房屋销售转机仍遥遥无期。【原文：China’s home sales slump dragged on in March, signaling a much-hoped turnaround for the sector isn’t in sight yet.】

item.title: 数十亿资金涌入主动型 ETF 寻找廉价发展中股票
item.description: 随着投资者在全球范围内寻找价值被低估的股票，一个越来越受欢迎的投资目的地就是专注于新兴市场的主动管理交易所交易基金。【原文：As investors scour the globe for under-valued stocks, one increasingly popular destination is actively managed exchange-traded funds that focus on emerging markets.】

item.title: 中国工业增长是经济复苏的最新迹象
item.description: 中国的制造业活动在 3 月份出现反弹，结束了连续 5 个月的下滑，进一步证明中国的工业部门正在为经济复苏造势。【原文：China’s manufacturing activity rebounded in March, snapping a five-month decline and adding to evidence that country’s industrial sector is building momentum for an economic recovery.】

item.title: 卡塔尔在大规模液化天然气扩建前签订更多船舶合同
item.description: 卡塔尔能源公司（QatarEnergy）已签署四项协议，从亚洲船舶运营商租用 19 艘液化天然气运输船，准备提高产量。【原文：QatarEnergy has signed four agreements to charter 19 liquefied natural gas carriers from Asian ship operators as it prepares to ramp up output.】

item.title: 日本就毒素调查对小林工厂进行第二天视察
item.description: 日本厚生劳动省在周日的一份声明中说，日本当局对小林制药株式会社（Kobayashi Pharmaceutical Co.【原文：Japanese authorities carried out a second day of inspections at Kobayashi Pharmaceutical Co.’s factory in Wakayama prefecture over safety concerns about the drugmaker’s health supplements, the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare said in a statement on Sunday.】

item.title: 顶级冰淇淋制造商待售，投资者无从选择
item.description: 内战结束时，威廉-布雷尔在费城用奶油、蔗糖和坚果手工搅拌出了第一加仑冰淇淋。他承诺使用最优质的原料，他的作品被装在一个大桶里，桶内有一个转动桨叶的手柄，然后卖给邻居。【原文：William Breyer hand-churned his first gallon of ice cream in Philadelphia at the end of the Civil War using cream, cane sugar and nuts. With the promise of the finest ingredients, his creation was cranked in a large bucket with a handle turning a paddle inside, and sold to his neighbors.】

item.title: 英加未能达成协议，贸易壁垒将增加
item.description: 允许英国免关税向加拿大销售含有欧盟部件的产品的条款将于周一到期，此前两国未能就延期问题达成协议。【原文：Provisions allowing the UK to sell products containing European Union parts to Canada tariff-free will expire on Monday, after the two countries failed to reach an agreement on extensions.】

item.title: 可可价格飙升的原因及其对巧克力爱好者的意义
item.description: 可可豆的价格在两年多的时间里持续上升，3 月份更是一飞冲天，期货合约的价格在三个月内翻了一番多，达到了之前最高纪录的两倍。可可豆价格的上涨源于西非的小农场，但也与气候变化和错综复杂的期货市场有关。最近的飙升部分是受金融动荡的推动，当大宗商品上涨过快，以至于压垮了旨在防止大宗商品价格暴跌的策略时，就会出现这种情况。【原文：A steady rise in the price of cocoa beans over two years skyrocketed in March, with futures contracts more than doubling in three months to reach a level twice as high as the previous record. It’s a progression that has its literal roots in small West African farms but also involves climate change and the intricacies of the futures market. The latest surge has been driven in part by the kind of financial turmoil that can happen when commodities rise so fast that they overwhelm strategies meant t】

item.title: 中国工厂活动六个月来首次增长
item.description: 中国 3 月份的制造业活动自 9 月份以来首次出现扩张，这表明世界第二大经济体正在企稳。【原文：China’s manufacturing activity expanded in March for the first time since September, a sign that the world’s second-largest economy is stabilizing.】
